name: gusplease
text: With this strip as an influence, I painted WORD UP on the side of a warehouse in LA's Chinatown once.

name: twotonturkey
text: that is pretty raw, to do a crime and then post about it on the internet.  (seriously, this comment is made without any sort of sarcasm)

name: chaesar
text:
Chubbies for the both of you.

p.s. I wrote 'penis' on a paper towel dispenser in my high school bathroom one time. IMMORTALITY!

name: gouldgonewild
text: One time, I wrote "The chamber of secrets has been opened" in the girls' bathroom at my old high school.

name: evolume
text: but yer a DUDE...

name: gouldgonewild
text: On the internets, assuredly.

name: gumfish
text: Alas, poor girl. I knew her, DUDE...

name: drskradley
text: At my old high school was the words "MORE FUCK" carved into the table of the Yr 12 common room.  Always a personal favourite of mine.

name: heccibiggs
text: Hey, you're British. High five.

name: hairymoonstone
text: The best thing were i live in Oxford is the spelling corrections and grammar alterations in the graffiti; that and the whitty remarks spray painted: 'Capitalism is boring'.

name: deusoma
text: Written on a fence across the road from an elementary school for the better part of 12 years, in two foot high letters: "SEX TO THE bus". I don't know why they switched to lowercase either.

name: gunsofray
text: Suddenly, they became embarrassed about shouting as people were listening to their fence.

name: soticoto
text:
In my local pub (the Dev, Camden), there was a lot of graffiti enticing people to steal the cutlery of celebrities... until it was painted over.
And also a lot about fucking the pohlice and your mother.

name: fineoakstructure
text: "'I fuck arses'. Who fucks arses? Maybe he fucks arses!"

name: jamb23
text: Yes, totally and completely. Although there is also some of the lamest, worse-than-Banksy social criticism on the walls as well. Have you seen the one up near Keble that said "Remember What Happened To The Dinosaur"? That was the WANKIEST.

name: dusty
text: there was this long ad, or offer i guess you would cal it, written on the wall of a stall in the library men's room, something like "If you want some head on the lowdown give me a call..." under it someone had written "you are gay"

name: slab64
text: That's pretty much boilerplate for mens room graffiti.

name: dusty
text: I don't know, I've never been to The Boiler Plate but it sounds like a place that would have a lot of mens room graffiti.

name: random_shorts
text: That was an astute observation that the respondant made.

name: landowmpg
text:
My favourite graffiti was written on the inside of a bathroom stall at camp:

Here I sit in stinky vapour,
Waiting for some toilet paper.
How much longer
Must I linger,
Before I'm forced
To use my finger.

name: fuzzyshoo
text:
Here I sit, broken hearted
Came to shit, but only farted

Some come here to sit and think
Others come to shit and stink
I came here to scratch my balls
And write graffiti on the walls

name: dusty
text:
In my inbox list this was "Here I sit, broken hearted
Came to shit, but only ..." it made me expect the rest to be "learn the shocking truth, only $8"

name: gumfish
text: Do what I did. Only 10k up front.

name: jsavinc
text:
Apparently, the first two lines have been translated into Serbian and written in the men's room at my college.
Not only that, but it seems that the two versions have the same number of syllables or are at least rhythmically similar. I can only compare them to the similarity of the words mother or sister in several peoples' languages.
They two lines are a Thing, apparently.

name: gumfish
text:
...

Her sitter jeg med mitt knuste hjerte.
Kom for å drite, klarte kun fjerte.

name: duperando
text: This is truly an exemplary comment.

name: closefriend
text: It is the code word. Now that I've heard the call I've got to get it under way.

name: dropkickpikachu
text:
If there's music, you could use it.

Feel free to dance.

name: zefiel
text: A comment left by zefiel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ezcmac, divot, shoinan)

name: deimosrising
text: Why is Roast Beef so upset I don't understand and it makes me scared

name: magnumt
text: Maybe he thinks that Ray is lying to him like he did that time with the rudest titties.

name: lateadopter
text:
Roast Beef does not seem to approve of drugs; he insisted on a hermetic plexiglas dome for the stoned softball league.

He may also be jealous that his best friend, who just lied to him to get him to come back from the moon and then shot him, has started up a company with Teodor.

name: deusoma
text: The words "who just lied to him to get him to come back from the moon and then shot him" may be the funniest statement I have heard, ever.

name: slab64
text:
His distaste for drugs might come from the fact that the only time he ever toked he killed himself on a golf cart.

Or has that happened yet?

name: crumpetsandtea
text: A comment left by crumpetsandtea was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stevegt500, Belgand, Lutipold, mistlethrush)

name: heccibiggs
text: Yeah, I hear frequent drug use tends to lead to a happier outlook on life and greater mental and emotional wellbeing.

name: heccibiggs
text: Uhh I'm not as anti-drug as that sounded. But come on. That was just dumb.

name: stonecrab
text: It can actually help depression.  Depends on the person, depends on the weed.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: Call me.

name: stonecrab
text: I chubbied ya -- that good enough??

name: quaga
text: I never quite understood this, as he seems to smoke weed quite regularly on the blog.

name: giantants
text: One of the first I ever saw.  Needless to say, it was enough.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: I love this strip, but why is Beef so mad? I just...don't understand.

name: gothfae
text: Perhaps it is because Ray took Phillipe's advice over his at the focus group?

name: philosophe
text: RB hates stoners

name: shmuckeles
text: i've seen peeps with depression lash out like this. it seems like a pretty awesome build-up for a lame burn when a dude is just inviting you over to celebrate. but depressed people ARE kind of sick in their minds so who knows WHAT is going on wih beef today. all i know is i don't have time for him when he's like this - he can basically stay in and code, because i'm going to hang out with my friends. Fine. FINE!

name: lawbot
text: YES

name: hannibalv
text:
As someone who (like Beef) is a guy who sucks, I can tell you that I've had that reaction--when it's so bad that the last possible thing you could want is to be around people having a good time, with the smiles they don't realize are smug and the statements of good cheer that strike like gloating.

Excuse me, my toast is stuck.

name: prolefeed5
text: I always thought he just felt left out...

name: magb
text: In this strip, Roast Beef lays down the smack.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I think maybe some people have been throwing stuff at Roast Beef and that has made him mad? He even made a sign about it.

name: pr0ncess
text: No, it's a sign reminding him not to throw stuff at the wall. Written on behalf of the wall.

name: heyman
text: I have never seen that sign until today, I love it now

name: saint
text: nah man huey don't smoke no weed

name: relaxing
text: "I Want A New Drug" seems to suggest that in fact he has.

name: chrisb
text: Aberlour isn't exactly "kinky", it is good though

name: deancain29
text: Beef makes his case.

name: tellumo
text: It's a Don't Throw Stuff at Roast Beef Thursday.

name: songbirdspectre
text: damn frickin straight it is.

name: charchar
text: when is it okay to throw stuff things at Beef?

name: farqussus
text: Tuesday

name: tetrisattack
text: Alt text: Huey Lewis used to the same thing as his mom's house at christmas, in the bathroom

name: songbirdspectre
text: don't throw stuff at ME.

name: shogun
text: Once upon a time, I was on a message board I frequent, and somebody had a link with the text "Kinky Abelour" in their sig. Eventually I got curious and clicked on it. The rest, as they say, is history.

name: javonathan
text: Roast Beef is above the influence.

name: serf
text: WORD UP

name: mountaindewtab
text: Huey Lewis is referenced alot in American Psycho.

name: tekende
text: Their undisputed masterpiece is "Hip to Be Square."

name: landowmpg
text: Beautiful.

name: cheezeburger
text:
Two possibilites here:
1. Beef has pent-up anger at Ray for not noticing his little cries for help.

2. Other possibility: Beef is RIGHTEOUSLY upset at Ray for not being a proper player. Single-malts and Guinness? Huey Lewis? Weed- OK, fine, but out of a bong? More like a South Bay yuppie than a player. Might as well be Paul Giamatti in "Sideways." Don't get me wrong, I like Aberlour just fine but then I ain't no hip hop playa.

name: pkitty
text: Y'know, I have to say... this is my single favorite Roast Beef strip ever. Why is he upset? Does he even know? Probably not -- and you KNOW that he sat down and cried for at least an hour after hanging up that phone. And yet, even knowing that, it's still funny as hell in a way that I can't even try to put my finger on. 5.

name: snowman
text: Yep, I agree.  Plus, his insult is SO BAD at the end, it barely makes sense!  Really funny, but I kinda feel bad for Beef here.

name: ovenface
text: i always kind of figured beef's upset with ray for starting a computer-based business with teodore after what happened to ray and beef's eggminder business. beef is fired by his best friend, then left out of the next business venture and then invited to the celebration party? poor taste, ray. you couldn't even have an eggminder celebration party. you couldn't, because you fired roast beef.

name: direhaggis
text: I have the feeling, given a good enough event in their lives, Ray and Teodor could paint either some or all of the town red--probably using a giant pneumatic sprinkler-system devised by Ray as originally stipulated in a grant for city-wide pipe density reduction.

name: milkpants
text:
i want a new drug.
not really

name: jhunter
text:
This is... my favourite Achewood. Why is Beef driven into righteous rage by this combination of factors? Why does Guinness, Huey Lewis & the News, and weed cause such a fury?

I also enjoy the juxtaposition between the scrawled "WORD UP" and the "don't throw stuff at ME".

name: mikeronomicon
text: If Beef were to get baked, it may make him more popular with the ladies. If not, at least he's baked.

name: nbgreene
text: i like to think that beef slammed down the phone first and then just yelled his comment to an empty room.  ray is probably just like "huh?"

name: puguglypress
text: Didn't it used to say "Don't yell at me?"

name: undyingsong
text: So many beefaces down here...
